intro: Hieracium thapsoides var. coronariifolium, commonly known as the crownleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant features a robust root system and grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its showy yellow flowers are typically arranged in clusters, and it is often found in meadows and disturbed soils. This variant is distinguished by its distinctive crown-like arrangement of leaves, giving it its common name.
